intro: Agrostophyllum spinuliferum subsp. misoense, commonly known as the Misoense grass. It is a perennial herb native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale yellow to greenish flowers. This subspecies is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils.
